alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 12:34PM AKDT until April 10 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Northwest winds gusting to 30 mph. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue through Monday, then taper off Monday afternoon. Between 4 and 6 inches of snow are expected north of the Alaska Highway through Monday. The Alaska Highway is expected to have 2 inches of snow through Monday. Northwest winds gusting to 30 mph along the Alaska Highway will cause blowing and drifting snow into Monday morning with low visibility at times. Winds will decrease on late Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
